description: From Latin exacerbo (“to provoke”); ex (“out of; thoroughly”) + acerbo (“to embitter, harshen or worsen”).

verbs.description: exacerbate (third-person singular simple present exacerbates, present participle exacerbating, simple past and past participle exacerbated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make worse (a problem, bad situation, negative feeling, etc.); aggravate.
examples: The proposed shutdown would exacerbate unemployment problems.
